DataElement.longName: Disease Progression or Recurrence Anatomic Site Uberon Identifier
DataElement.definition: The location within the body where a disease has progressed or recurred as captured in the Uberon identifier.

DataElementConcept.longName: Disease Progression or Recurrence Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The anatomic site(s) at which a disease has progressed or recurred.
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes:
4/23/24 Released per DSS SN CADSR0003668. mr; 
4/3/24 Created for CRDC RFC49. Bf

ObjectClass.definition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.longName: Progressive or Recurrent Disease Anatomic Site
Property.definition: The anatomic site(s) at which a disease has progressed or recurred.

Concepts.longName: Progressive or Recurrent Disease Anatomic Site
Concepts.definition: The anatomic site(s) at which a disease has progressed or recurred.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols and characters to capture the UBERON anatomic site code (ex: UBERON:0006209 or UBERON_0006209)._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueMeaning.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

RepresentationTerm.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

ReferenceDocuments.documentText: Progression or Recurrence Site Uberon ID

1. Go to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/uberon
2. Use the search field to search for your term.
3. Use the Copy button at the top of the search results to copy the Uberon ID.
